alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Coshocton; Guernsey; Harrison; Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 05 at 6:30PM EDT until April 05 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN HARRISON...NORTH CENTRAL GUERNSEY...NORTHEASTERN COSHOCTON...WESTERN CARROLL AND TUSCARAWAS COUNTIES... At 630 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Sugarcreek, or near Dover, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... New Philadelphia, Dover, Uhrichsville, Carrollton, Freeport, Dennison, Strasburg, Sugarcreek, Gnadenhutten, Malvern, Tuscarawas, and Bolivar. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
